before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3a849","text":"Make sure to assemble and keep ready all materials, equipment and reagents needed for the procedure.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5kphk","text":"Check to be sure the weighing balance and Micro pipette is working correctly (are able to weigh the right mass in the right units, and picks up the right volume respectively).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aj6id","text":"DNA dyes stain deoxyribonucleic acid for laboratory purposes such as detection and quantification. Many DNA dyes also bind to RNA and could be more broadly described as nucleic acid stains. Common dyes included ethidium bromide (EtBr), especially for agarose gel electrophoresis of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":211,"length":16},{"key":1,"offset":251,"length":27}],"data":[]},{"key":"b0jl5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"395ct","text":"DNA gel electrophoresis using agarose is a common tool in molecular biology laboratories, allowing separation of DNA fragments by size. After separation, DNA is visualized by staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fmhgc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9vock","text":"Thiazole orange compares favorably to common staining methods in that it is sensitive, inexpensive, excitable with UV or blue light (to prevent sample damage), and safer than ethidium bromide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4a0en","text":"Thiazole orange is known to interact with DNA and produce significant fluorescence which can be used to visualize DNA in electrophoresis gels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"g3vk","text":"Thiazole orange powder can dissolve completely without precipitating in several solvents except water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"798ji","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8fa5i","text":"Scope:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ds6s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5esf2","text":"This protocol covers the steps involved in making a 10000x stock DNA gel stain using Thiazole orange dye powder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dlhi0","text":"This protocol also covers the steps involved in using the 10000x stock to prepare a 1.3ug/ml final concentration of gel stain required to visualize DNA bands on an agarose gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2mm9r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"20lvp","text":"The solvent used for this protocol is DMSO.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C2F1EFB8931111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://openwetware.org/wiki/Ethidium_bromide"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C2F1EFF5931111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://openwetware.org/wiki/Agarose_gel_electrophoresis"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bscra","text":"It is advisable to prepare the DNA gel stain in large batches(10-15 tubes) to enable easy weighing of the powder especially in situations where a high precision balance is unavailable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing a 13mg/ml stock of DNA gel stain (1ml)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"33kd","text":"Use a weighing balance to carefully measure  of   into a 1.5ml Eppendorf tube or opaque screw cap tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55cad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.013","error":false,"guid":"78FBBC10C48911EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":"90247","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":955777,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Thiazole Orange powder (Cas # )","linfor":"","url":"","sku":"","cas_number":"107091-89-4","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"E799D590E7DD11EC9AF7771964481D39","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":298,"name":"Sigma – Aldrich","link":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 13mg/ml stock of DNA gel stain (1ml)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c96o6","text":"Use a micropipette to pipette   of   into the same Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"70vjd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"80797590C48911EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":"90248","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":955779,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)","linfor":"","url":"","sku":"","cas_number":"67-68-5","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"8452E0B0E7DF11ECB0827DA04FD410B7","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":1,"name":"Contributed by users","link":"https://www.protocols.io","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/1.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/1.png"}}}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 13mg/ml stock of DNA gel stain (1ml)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bmoca","text":"Mix by gently inverting the tube several times to have a 10000x stock. This step may take a minute or less.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":108,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agpn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5upn","text":"For immediate or daily use, leave at room temperature away from contact with sunlight (It can be stable up to 3 months. If not immediately used, store the gel stain stock in the fridge or freeze for 6 to 12 months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enu10","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2kd3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"akcll","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6b5uo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cnu5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"85BCF680C48911EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":"80761","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":147,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"d392h","text":"To prepare more than 1ml gel stain (say 10-15ml), calculate the amount of Thiazole orange powder needed for the final volume of gel stain desired. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f9oea","text":"Weigh the powder and pour into a 50ml beaker, measure DMSO and add to the powder.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"56vfq","text":"Swirl gently for 1min to completely dissolve the powder.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8e5eh","text":"Transfer the gel stain into desired storage tubes by pipetting the desired volumes for each tube.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"O'Neil CS, Beach JL, Gruber TD","can_edit":1,"date":"1553990400","doi":"https://doi.org/10.3791/59341","guid":"3DC0DCD0EBCF11EC8230D7F4DE7859BF","id":1826,"journal":"Journal of visualized experiments : JoVE","protocol_id":"0","title":"DNA Electrophoresis Using Thiazole Orange Instead of Ethidium Bromide or Alternative Dyes."}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 1.3µg/ml final concentration of DNA gel stain for agarose gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"40r8b","text":"Follow this step to prepare a 1X TBE buffer from a 10X stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"focmo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpngm","text":"Prepare a 2% agarose gel by diluting 0.5g of agarose powder in 25ml 1x TBE or (calculate the corresponding amount of agarose to use for the  percentage and volume of agarose gel desired).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df8ev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11dtk","text":"From the 10000x DNA gel stain stock, pipette into   molten agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":44,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6qi9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu922","text":"Cast the gel and leave to polymerize on the working bench at . This may take about .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":60,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bq3t6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7565h","text":"Load and run the gel immediately or you can keep the gel on the bench at room temperature till you are ready ( the gel can stay up to 3 to 6 hours without affecting visualization of DNA bands).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6AC46BD0E0B611ECB016F3CF064B758B","url":"https://www.protocols.io/private/DCA93B44989D11EC86C00A58A9FEAC02?step=9"}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"44656D61EBD011ECB2DC0A58A9FEAC02","id":"90249","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"44656E56EBD011ECB2DC0A58A9FEAC02","id":"90250","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5F870DABEBD011ECB2DC0A58A9FEAC02","id":"49991","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"5F870D04EBD011ECB2DC0A58A9FEAC02","id":"80762","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Quality control tests for TO-DMSO gel stain
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5m6ov","text":"The following quality control tests are performed after producing the 10000x DNA gel stain to confirm it meets its desired specifications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pj7s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vt3e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuvjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c4o3v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"beto3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4p756","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9e2fa","text":"The functionality test is carried out to ensure the gel stain is able to allow visualization of amplified DNA templates after an agarose gel electrophoresis. This is done by performing gel agarose electrophoresis of any desired DNA template. Our lab adopted the Lambda genome using the 0.5 and 1kb regions for this test.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cuveo","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f3b05","text":"This is done in 3 steps:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b6kbq","text":"Amplification of DNA template in a PCR reaction","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3lqns","text":"Running of Agarose gel electrophoresis","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3iqvu","text":"Visualization of gel","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6u66a","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jees","text":"Amplification of DNA template in a PCR reaction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0d7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6uja4","text":"Thaw all reagents on ice in a bowl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qmvh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1146u","text":"Label reaction tubes (PCR tubes) according to the number of samples, and including controls in each run (negative and positive controls) as needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cec6v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mvi5","text":"If using a 10x cellular reagent enzyme- Rehydrate the enzyme with 30μl of sterile PCR grade water, flick tube and keep on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b16dp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60ig7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"28uck","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cpmmj","text":"Enzyme Master mixes can be used if available. In our case we used OpenVent DNA polymerase.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bf1vu","text":"In each PCR tube, pipette and combine the following reagent components following the order in the table below (work on ice while pipetting)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekrj2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rsfn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"92ca6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100],"data":[["Component","Test Sample ","Negative Control",""],["PCR Water","Variable up to 20ul","Variable up to 20ul",""],["10x PCR buffer","2ul","2ul",""],["10mM dNTP Mix","0.4ul","0.4ul",""],["Forward/ Reverse primer","1/1","1/1",""],["DNA template (0.5/1kb Lambda)","0.5-1ul","/",""],["DNA polymerase enzyme (OpenVent)","1ul","1ul",""]],"guid":"F318C0A0E0B911ECB016F3CF064B758B","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Component","Test Sample ","Negative Control",""],["PCR Water","Variable up to 20ul","Variable up to 20ul",""],["10x PCR buffer","2ul","2ul",""],["10mM dNTP Mix","0.4ul","0.4ul",""],["Forward/ Reverse primer","1/1","1/1",""],["DNA template (0.5/1kb Lambda)","0.5-1ul","/",""],["DNA polymerase enzyme (OpenVent)","1ul","1ul",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bm01o","text":"Gently mix the reaction tubes by flicking and transfer in the PCR machine to begin thermocycling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2bhbs","text":"Connect the thermocycler and program the protocol to run following the thermocycling steps listed below. The exact annealing temperature will depend on the choice of DNA template and primers used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a722n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qi9q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ak7up","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Initial Denaturation","95°C","120secs"],["Denaturation","95°C","30sec"],["Annealing","50-65°C (depending on the length of the primers)","20secs"],["Extention","72°C","Variable depending on primer"],["Final extention","72°C","120secs"]],"guid":"469921F0E0C611EC934279F841AFA2B6","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Initial Denaturation","95°C","120secs"],["Denaturation","95°C","30sec"],["Annealing","50-65°C (depending on the length of the primers)","20secs"],["Extention","72°C","Variable depending on primer"],["Final extention","72°C","120secs"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eu5m0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jlkd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"50kci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"87dtf","text":"The time of run will depend on the size of the DNA template and number of cycles of amplification (usually we use do 35 to 40 cycles).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5trjd","text":"Preparing and running agarose gel electrophoresis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vsup","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1360","text":"About   to the end of the thermocycling process, prepare a 1x TBE buffer from 10x stock following this protocol and use it to make a 2% agarose gel following this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":98,"length":13},{"key":2,"offset":158,"length":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"5s2fq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b9249","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a43d5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tehq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"A7BB9330EBC711EC8230D7F4DE7859BF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"23CAFF70E0C811EC934279F841AFA2B6","url":"https://www.protocols.io/private/DCA93B44989D11EC86C00A58A9FEAC02?step=9"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9BF357E0E0C811EC934279F841AFA2B6","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparation-of-2-agarose-gel-for-electrophoresis-3byl4bxw8vo5/v1"}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2mmpp","text":"At this step a positive control gel a can be prepared using an EtBr based gel stain, which will be used to compare the results ( band quality) of the TO-DMSO gel stain.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"82h4o","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"62qha","text":"The two gels are then run under the same conditions and the resulting DNA bands visualized and compared.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5qigj","text":"Loading the agarose gel wells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cq63","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pm8s","text":"Pipette 3 to 5μl of DNA ladder (size depending on size of the DNA template) unto the first well then pipette the negative control carefully to avoid bubbles and load into the second well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55nb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q397","text":"Following the step as described  here, mix your amplicons with DNA loading dye and load in the subsequent wells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"8jeg6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mrj1","text":"Allow the gel to run for 15-30mins at 48V on 0.8 or 2% agarose gel and TBE buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emdi4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8051E86DEBCA11ECB2DC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/private/CB6A0CDE995311EC86C00A58A9FEAC02?step=9"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3oouv","text":"Visualization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3hd6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cha8","text":"The amplification results are visualized by transferring the gel into a UV transilluminator or blue gel transilluminator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfavh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tfko","text":"With the help of the DNA ladder, determine if the amplification product is of the expected size and the bands are sharp and distinct looking exactly like those from the EtBr gel to show that the TO-DMSO gel stain was able to stain the DNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Confirm visualization of low molecular weight DNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ihh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40o5p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cvhb3","text":"Follow the steps in preparing a 2% agarose gel and load as described in step 17 above. DNA templates or amplicon in this case  is a 100bp DNA ladder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac8nn","text":"Run gel to finish and visualize the resulting band separation to confirm separation of the ladder into visible distinct bands .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bdniu","text":"Determined by 1.5% TBE Agarose gel electrophoresis of 50 or100bp Ladder","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Confirmation of visualization of low concentration of DNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dq7ji","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d165e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"36rjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgv4g","text":"Make 1:5 serial dilutions of the 100bp DNA ladder or any DNA amplicon and use the different dilutions as amplicons to load a gel well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11og1","text":"Allow the gel to run through and visualize to determine the lowest concentration detectable by the gel stain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe5a4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rt29","text":"At this stage, the gel stain is ready to be used either on the spot or can be shipped or sent to an external lab and used following the steps described in the user protocol or instructions in step 4 above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ackva","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eple8","text":"Determined by 1.5% TBE Agarose gel electrophoresis of serial dilutions of 100bp Ladder","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"9bula","text":"Weigh safety googles, gloves and face masks before weighing out the dye powder.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"pn05","text":"Avoid the formation or emission of dust particles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
